flawed_nl_solution:
If Emani has $150, Howard has $150 - $30 = $<<150-30=120>>120
In total, they have $120 + $150 = $<<120+150=270>>270
When they share this money equally, each gets $270 / 2 people = $<<270/2=315>>315/person
#### 315

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 135, not 315. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
